result.execSummary:
The defendant Chalice D Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chalice D Wade in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions her as to her right to an Atty.  Defendant does not wish to have an Atty.  Court finds defendant has freely waived her right to an atty.   Defendant entered plea of guilty.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; Court goes thru plea questionnaire on the record parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty.

COURT: Costs $443.00 given 60 dtp or set up payment plan - 1 year from today if no further criminal charges court will expunge record she needs to apply

Defendant Chalice D Wade in court.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea.   DEF temporarily waives right to counsel to speak to DA office.  Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Chalice Wade in court, in custody appeared by video.   Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State.  PC found by court.  SIBS $500.00  No Abusive contact with Casey McKnight or Diane McKnight and  Absolute Sobriety
